title: Album Page, "Sketches of Window Elements, Possibly the Abbey of Chiaravalle, Milan", late 19th century
medium: Graphite on very smooth, thin off-white wove paper tipped into binding with fabric
inscribed: Recto, in graphite, upper right corner: 96; lower right corner: 84; top edge of sheet: 5th w - and comm..ic...nt of 3rd story; lower center left of drawing: cloister o.. / chiaravalle / p..i.. de ....ilau.
dimensions: Sheet: 30.6 x 19.6 cm (12 1/16 x 7 11/16 in.), irregular
description: Vertical sheet that has been cut down from a larger sheet containing numerous sketches of architectural elements from a church.   At the top is a sketch of a window opening with three round arches.  To the right of this is a small object, possibly a doorknocker, seen in elevation.  In the center are two plans of the window above measured at two different locations.  Below this is a section of an arcade with two columns seen in plan above it and in elevation to the left.  There are many inscriptions throughout the sheet with dimensions and measurements.

tombstone.epitaph: Album Page, "Sketches of Window Elements, Possibly the Abbey of Chiaravalle, Milan", late 19th century.Graphite on very smooth, thin off-white wove paper tipped into binding with fabric. Gift of Mrs. William Greenough. 1943-51-257.
